software.name: Non-Linear Code
software.description: Dextro writes ‘non-linear code’ drawing inspiration from nature. The results are non-fractal or random programs that iterate without change, with equal rules for all objects. Most of the scripts rely on trigonometry and could be seen as sets of wave generators interacting with one another. Some of these pieces take years to develop but the code is usually short but complex.

software.name: Computational design methodologies for large-scale 3D printing
software.description: With an exponential increase in the possibilities of computation and computer-controlled fabrication, architecture is now facing a novel challenge. Bartlett School of Architecture’s RC4 in London researches computational design methodologies for large-scale 3D printing with industrial robots, taking logistical, structural and material constraints as design opportunities.

software.name: May The Force Be With You
software.description: “May the Force be With You” is a kinetic installation that invites visitors to engage with an interactive water tank. The tank uses gravitational force driven by the position of the viewer’s hand movement.

software.name: Filament Sculptures
software.description: For about a year now generative artist Lia has been exploring 3d printing by analysing filament and the movements of the printhead. Rather than just having 3d models printed out, Lia has been interested in the possibilities of the process by defining the location of the printhead, the speed of the movement and the amount of filament that should be extruded.

software.name: Fall in Love - Phantogram
software.description: Music video for Phantogram's Voices album campaign including the "Fall In Love" music video directed by Timothy Saccenti and Joshua Davis with video elements created using the HYPE framework in Processing.

software.name: Keyflies
software.description: Created by Miles Peyton, first year student at the Carnegie Mellon University, Keyfleas is an experiment in interactive augmented projection. Miles used Processing and Box2D to create an augmented projection on the keyboard. As the user types, the “fleas” swarm around the pressed key, avoiding the letters.

software.name: Petting Zoo
software.description: Created by London based experimental architecture and design studio Minimaforms, this project is speculative life-like robotic environment that raises questions of how future environments could actively enable new forms of communication with the everyday.

software.name: Fragmented Memory
software.description: Fragmented Memory are portraits of raw binary data extracted from computer memory and rendered as an image using Processing. These images are then imported into software used by textile designers and finally fed to computerised looms to weave the designs.

software.name: Avena+ Test Bed
software.description: Avena+ Test Bed is a project that explores the relationship between landscape, agriculture and digital fabrication by intercepting the process of precision farming by generative design.

software.name: Kinograph
software.description: Kinograph is an open source project that makes film digitisation affordable and scaleable. It uses components available on the internet, a few 3D printed parts, and a consumer level camera and it produces high quality video with sound.

software.name: .fluid
software.description: Created by Hannes Jung, .fluid is a concept study of an interacting, changing surface that uses non-newtonian fluid, an Arduino board, a speaker and Processing to allow surface to change from liquid to solid, from plain to three-dimensional symmetric patterns.

software.name: 3D Printed Record
software.description: Created using Processing, ModelBuilder Library by Marius Watz and a 3D printer, Amanda Ghassaei at instructables managed to print a 33rpm music record that actually doesn’t sound too bad considering the limitations of currently available 3d printing technologies.

software.name: Digital Natives and Glitched Realities
software.description: Digital Natives are everyday items such as toys and detergent bottles that are 3D scanned using a digital camera, subjected to algorithms that distort and finally 3D printed in colour resin/sandstone.

software.name: Stone Spray
software.by: Petr Novikov, Inder Shergill and Anna Kulik
software.description: Stone Spray is a construction method which uses soil as the base material and a liquid binder to solidify the soil granules. The device uses an Arduino UNO, Processing application and a custom built jet spray system to deposit the mix of soil and binder, for constructing architectural shapes.
software.link: Petr Novikov, Inder Shergill and Anna Kulik

software.name: City Symphonies
software.description: Mark McKeague explores an alternative of the traffic in the city where the sound that cars generate changes according to their relationship to other road users and the environment. Using Processing in combination with MaxMSP, a traffic simulation is used to power the movement of vehicles through different sections of road networks in London.

software.name: Silenc
software.by: Manas Karambelkar, Momo Miyazaki and Kenneth A. Robertsen
software.description: ‘Silenc’ is a visualization of an interpretation of silent letters within Danish, English and French languages done by eliminating or highlighting the silent letters within a prescribed text. The project was created at CIID, Data Visualization course with Golan Levin and Marcin Ignac - 2012.

software.name: unnamed soundsculpture
software.description: Produced by onformative and chopchop the “unnamed soundsculpture” is a project by Daniel Franke & Cedric Kiefer, building from the simple idea of creating a moving sand sculpture from the recorded motion data of a real person. Point cloud capture from Kinect was recorded in Processing then processed and rendered 3D Studio Max.

software.name: Soundmachines
software.description: The Product were commissioned by Volkswagen to develop a set of visuals for an interactive musical performance for the premiere of the New Beetle at the 2011 IAA motor show. What the client got instead was Soundmachines – a custom-built instrument for performing electronic music by DJing visual patterns on record-sized discs.

software.name: Composition No. 1
software.description: First written in 1961 by Marc Saporta, the new edition of this book is published by Visual Editions and designed by Universal Everything. The “book in a box” includes a cover illustration created using Processing.

software.name: Max Planck Reasearch Networks
software.description: This multi-touch installation reveals how Max Planck Institutes collaborate with each other, and with their international partners. For this visualization, the team analysed data from SciVerse Scopus for over 94,000 publications over the last ten years. A dynamic network and touch interface provide a high-level map of the institutes and their connections.

software.name: The Creators
software.by: Constanza Casas, Mark C Mitchell and Pieter Steyaert
software.description: The Creators is a response by information visualisation students at the University of Sydney to a design brief that called for an interactive experience on a 42″ multitouch table that visualised data in a novel.The team chose realtime audio of the room as the dataset, as a meditation on cause and effect: the viewers become participators, creators, even if they are unaware of it.

software.name: The Digital Rube Goldberg Processor
software.description: The Digital Rube Goldberg Processor is the outcome of a 4-day workshop The Product collective gave at the HfG Karlsruhe (Design School). Since they understand it is impossible to teach programming to beginners just within 4 days, they decided to focus more on the essential topics behind generative and computational design, to provide a grounded starting point for the students.

software.name: Prototyp-0
software.description: prototyp-0 is an application designed for the drawing of typographical characters. Created using Processing, the application automates the process allowing you to manipulate a large number of glyph properties in realtime.

software.name: Cascade
software.description: Cascade is the latest project by NYTimes R&D Lab that allows precise analysis of the structures that underly sharing activity on the web. This tool links browsing behavior on a site to sharing activity to construct a detailed picture of how information propagates through the social media space.

software.name: MIT Media Lab Identity
software.description: The new visual identity of the MIT Media Lab inspired by the community it comprises: Highly creative people from all kinds of backgrounds come together, inspire each other and collaboratively develop a vision of the future.

software.name: Continuum
software.description: The project is an attempt to blend rapid fabrication, interactive software, and the accessibility of the web, to let individuals participate directly in the design and production process of consumer products.

software.name: Process Compendium 2004-2010
software.description: Process Compendium 2004-2010 is a collection of work and record of process by Casey Reas, co-founder of Processing, presented and created entirely in Processing.

software.name: One Hundred and Eight
software.description: One Hundred and Eight is an interactive wall-mounted Installation made out of ordinary garbage bags. Controlled by an Arduino and Processing, each of the bags is selectively inflated and deflated in turn by cooling fans.

software.name: My Little Piece of Privacy
software.description: Niklas' workshop is located in an old storefront with a big window facing towards the street. In an attempt to create more privacy inside, Niklas decided to install a small but smart curtain.

software.name: Strata
software.description: The Strata project by Quayola consist of a series of films, prints and installations investigating improbable relationships between contemporary digital aesthetics and icons of classical art and architecture.

software.name: Understanding Shakespeare
software.description: Introducing a new form of reading drama to help understand Shakespeare’s works in new and insightful way. Using Processing, a number of word visualizations are created to highlight relationships throughout the play.

software.name: One Perfect Cube
software.description: Three synchronized clocks that form a cube image every twelve hours for exactly one second.

software.name: Feltron 2009 Annual Report
software.description: Each day in 2009, Felton asked every person with whom he had a meaningful encounter to submit a record of this meeting through an online survey...

software.name: Computing Kaizen
software.description: Toy software produced by an advanced graduate studio at the Columbia University GSAPP. Centered around the design of a technology incubator in the Akihabara district of Tokyo, this studio explored evolutionary structures that anticipate change and internalize complex relationships.

software.name: Fine Collection of Curious Sound Objects
software.description: Storytelling combined with physical computing. Six mundane objects incorporate sensors that trigger feedback to the user as part of a fictional history of the objects.

software.name: Just Landed
software.description: Combines Processing, Twitter, and MetaCarta to map the phrase "Just landed in..." onto the globe and renders as video.

software.name: John Henry von Neumann
software.description: Performance that recasts the archetypal conflict between human and machine labor as a competition to complete an algorithmic drawing in an eight-hour workday.

software.name: In the Air
software.description: Visualization project to reavel the invisible agents of Madrid's air (gases, particles, pollen, etc.), to see how they relate to the city.

software.name: Silica-Esc
software.description: Generative movie that portrays a possible computing platform for the future. The story takes place in Singapore, where a decision about the new device is about to be made.

software.name: Mycelium
software.description: A simulation of fungal hyphae growth using images as food.

software.name: The Jelly Face Experiments
software.description: Experiments with pixel-by-pixel operations in real time exploring the possibilities of the Processing video libraries. Playing with techniques like slit scan, frame differencing, and datamoshing.

software.name: New Year's Cards, 2001-2010
software.description: For nearly a decade, Golan Levin has used Processing to create his annual interactive holiday cards. Explore this set of modest projects which connect the dots through one artist's process -- and happy holidays!

software.name: COP15 Generative Identity
software.description: Software for generating the COP15 identity - the UN Climate Change Conference held in Copenhagen Dec 2009. It explores how turbulence and naturally evolving patterns can illustrate the complex decision making that goes on at the conference.

software.name: Branching Morphogenesis
software.description: Explores fundamental processes in living systems and their potential application in architecture. The installation materializes five slices in time that capture the force network exerted by interacting vascular cells.

software.name: Telekom Realtime Information Graphics
software.description: Realtime Information Graphics showing the international data interchange and the network traffic at the Product Experience Center of the Deutsche Telekom in Darmstadt, Germany.

software.name: Wayfarer
software.description: Wayfarer is a developing roguelike game with retro, quasi-3D graphics. Explore randomly generated dungeons and battle peculiar foes! Perish horribly!

software.name: Mud Tub
software.description: This experimental organic interface allows people to control a computer while playing in the mud. Through an API built with Processing, artists and designers develop mud-controlled games, physics simulations, and expressive tools.

software.name: MOSstack
software.by: MOS (Michael Meredith, Hilary Sample, William Macfarlane)
software.description: This software is for stacking blocks within an environment of forces. As each unit is stacked it simultaneously calculates its own weight and balance in real-time to produce strange structural forms.

software.name: Terre Natale (Exits 2)
software.by: Stewart Smith, Robert Gerard Pietrusko, Aaron Meyers, Michael Doherty, and Hans-Christoph Steiner
software.description: A half-hour immersive visualization of human migration data; premiered at the Fondation Cartier in Paris, 2008. Produced under Diller Scofidio + Renfro, et al.

software.name: MTV Brazil ID 2009
software.description: A software particle system creates variations of the MTV logotype.

software.name: Interim Camp
software.by: Marcus Wendt, Vera-Maria Glahn, Arran Poole
software.description: An experimental animation film based on drifting and morphing surface structures, created with a custom generative software tool. A meditation about the pursuit of an idea; about obstacles, struggle and failure along the way.

software.name: People Mover
software.description: A clockwork of colorful 'mobiles' assembles and unwinds according to data collected by three users of Nokia N95 smartphones over a period of several months.

software.name: BallDroppings
software.description: Turn your sound up. Draw lines on the black screen to bounce the balls. Enjoy the music.

software.name: Oasis
software.description: A playful space where people discover and explore virtual life.

software.name: Platonic Solids
software.description: Three-dimensional subdivision of platonic solids, inspired by Ernst Haeckel's 'Kunstformen der Natur.'

software.name: Monsters
software.description: Black and white, reactive monsters created by the Processing community.

software.name: Big Screens 2
software.description: For the second year, Dan Shiffman's NYU students write software for a 120 by 12 foot video wall at IAC's world headquarters in NYC.

software.name: The Emergence Project
software.description: Realtime art installation that explores how complex systems and patterns arise out of a multiplicity of simple interactions.

software.name: Roots
software.by: Memo Akten, Owen Vallis, Jordan Hochenbaum
software.description: An interactive installation where participants engage in making generative / semi-generative / and or composed music by moving their fingers and objects around the Brick multi-touch surface.

software.name: NPZvisualizer
software.description: Tool for exploring the dynamics of coastal marine ecosystems. Exchanges between plankton populations push the system sometimes toward equilibrium, sometimes into simple cycles, sometimes into chaos.

software.name: Mæve
software.by: Interface Design Team of FH Potsdam
software.description: Provides visual and tangible access to the conceptual networks behind architectural projects. The installation is part of the 11th International Architecture Exhibition of the Venice Biennale.

software.name: YMYI
software.by: Joao Martinho Moura and Jorge Sousa
software.description: Space where the user interacts with a living image through his body movements.
software.link: Master in Technology and Digital Art

software.name: Body Navigation
software.by: Jonas Jongejan and Ole Kristensen for Recoil Performance Group
software.description: Infrared motion tracking and floor projection installation for a Danish Dance Theatre production with choreographer Tina Tarpgaard.

software.name: News Knitter
software.description: Visualization of news feeds as knitted garments.

software.name: Wordscapes
software.description: A collection of reactive one-word poem landscapes.

software.name: Counterclockwise
software.description: A generative video piece with music by Hiaz.

software.name: proximityOfNeeds
software.description: Generative, parameterized images and sound.

software.name: Volume of Emptiness
software.description: Volume of Emptiness is an installation that continually unfolds architectural spaces. Virtual volumes are created by a field of motors in the ceiling that each have a number of threads attached to them.

software.name: Big Screens
software.description: Dan Shiffman's NYU students write software for a 120 by 12 foot video wall at IAC's world headquarters designed by Frank Gehry.

software.name: Nervous System, Play + Learn
software.description: Shows the global exchange of information by visualizing volumes of data flowing in and out of New York City.

software.name: NYTE
software.description: Shows the global exchange of information by visualizing volumes of data flowing in and out of New York City.

software.name: Cascade on Wheels
software.description: Two visualizations of traffic patterns in Madrid.

software.name: MYPOCKET
software.description: Discloses the artist's personal financial records by exploring and revealing essential patterns in daily transactions.

software.name: Michael Fakesch Vidos
software.description: Music video for Michael Fakesch's upcoming DVD release Vidos that accompanies his album Dos.

software.name: White Glove Tracking
software.description: Internet users isolated and then visualized Michael Jackson's white glove in all 10,060 frames of his nationally televised landmark performance of Billy Jean.

software.name: Birds!
software.description: Exploration of flocking behavior used to collaborate with Nando Costa in producing telvision spots for FOX Japan.

software.name: Microsoft Live / Operation Smile
software.description: A generative art exhibition projected onto a seven-story sphere located at New York's South Street Seaport.

software.name: Similar Diversity
software.description: A data visualization based on the Holy Books of five world religions.

software.name: The Sheep Market
software.description: The Sheep Market is a collection of 10,000 sheep made by workers on Amazon's Mechanical Turk. Workers were paid $0.02 (USD) to "draw a sheep facing to the left."

software.name: Celestial Workshops
software.description: Celestial Workshops is a suite of drawing tools created in Processing that control CNC milling machinery as a method of carving relief blocks for printmaking.

software.name: Anymails
software.description: Email visualization that uses the visual language of microbes to show mail structure and attributes.

software.name: Champs d'Ozone
software.description: A moving cloud that hangs above the skyline of Paris and changes color with the actual air quality.

software.name: Time Travel Tube Map
software.description: Reorganizes the London Underground map to visualize travel times from station to station.

software.name: Fidg't Visualizer
software.description: Visualize social networks through Flickr and LastFM tags.

software.name: Lovebytes 2007
software.description: A population of unique friendly furry faces to appear across all festival literature for Lovebytes 2007.

software.name: Reconfigurable House
software.description: An environment constructed from thousands of low tech components that can be reconfigured by its occupants.

software.name: Muon Launch
software.description: Audio responsive installation for the launch of the Muon speakers at the Milan Furniture Fair 2007.

software.name: Universe
software.description: If we could make new constellations in today's night sky, what would they be? Universe is a system to help us decide.

software.name: Software Kaleidoscope
software.description: Installation for Samsung that turns images from the environment into symmetrical patterns.

software.name: State of the Union
software.description: Provides access to the corpus of all the State of the Union addresses from 1790 to 2006.

software.name: Yo soy la Juani
software.description: The title sequence of Bigas Luna's feature film "Yo soy la Juani" (2006) was made using Processing.

software.name: Spies
software.by: Lisa Strausfeld and James N. Sears
software.description: Physics-based modeling of the relationships between key phrases that describe terrorist attacks.

software.name: Mutualism
software.description: The continuous mutual shape of a shared public server.

software.name: Grass
software.description: Interactive projection wall promoting Saturn for the 2006 Wired NextFest.

software.name: Blinks & Buttons
software.description: Networked photography reveals what happened simultaneously in the world.

software.name: Shadow Monsters
software.description: Monsters appear from the shadows cast by the hands of participants.

software.name: Ping Genius Loci
software.description: Three hundred networked analogue pixels place in a 20 by 20 meter grid.

software.name: We Feel Fine
software.description: An exploration of human emotion on a global scale using data gathered from blogs.

software.name: Visual Scratch
software.description: Realtime visualization of scratch DJ performance.

software.name: Khronos Projector
software.description: Software demos for a video time-warping machine with a tangible deformable screen.

software.name: Dreamlines
software.description: A crowd of autonomous particles drawing your ever-flowing dreams.

software.name: The Dumpster
software.description: An interactive online visualization that attempts to depict a slice through the romantic lives of American teenagers.

software.name: Polyptic
software.description: A dynamically generated visualization consisting of a 2D matrix of cells that can flip between two states.

software.name: Parametric Difference
software.description: Formal and spatial exploration of boolean difference applied to two systems.

software.name: A String
software.description: Shadowgraphs for dance performance 'be silent' at the national theater of korea.

software.name: Jellyfish
software.description: Visualization of an encyclopedia of the arts.

software.name: Flight Patterns
software.description: Flight pattern visualizations from FAA data parsed and plotted in Processing.

software.name: Aqueous
software.description: Aqueous is a meditative space that encourages perception of small things. Water droplets fall from the ceiling through the space into water-filled tubes approximately tuned in a scale spanning two octaves.

software.name: Net Worth
software.description: How much do you really matter? Net Worth is an installation exploring our current condition where information is given more prominence than the corporeal.

software.name: Letter-pairs Analysis
software.description: Showing the number of times each pair of letters appears in a given text.

software.name: Unreal Art
software.description: Generating illustration from pathed bot positions in a live Unreal Tournament Deathmatch game.

software.name: Manifest
software.description: Drawing program where different gestures create varying organisms animated through procedural animation and physics simulations.

software.name: VJ
software.description: Live visuals for Bit Shifter performance at the Bridge, Toronto. Software controlled with a custom interface utilizing Griffin Powermates.

software.name: Metropop Denim
software.description: Fashion photography meets print resolution physics-inspired generative artwork.

software.name: ElectroPlastique 1
software.description: 4-screen temporal composition for the Territoires Electroniques festival in Aix-en-Provence inspired by Victor Vasarely. Sound by James Welburn.

software.name: Thinking Machine 4
software.description: Explores the invisible, elusive nature of thought. Play chess against a transparent intelligence, its evolving thought process visible on the board before you.

software.name: Timescape
software.description: Photographs made from a continious 1 pixel lines captured by a camera.

software.name: Ortho-type
software.by: Enrico Bravi, Mikkel Crone Koser & Paolo Palma
software.description: An experiment in dimensional typography.

software.name: Acoustic Cartography
software.description: Experiment in mapping sonic events into a concrete visual language.

software.name: min_mod
software.description: A sound phenomenon represented through a spatial distribution of minimal elements, creating a sensitive environment influenced by the sounds generated in the surrounding space.

software.name: Chronodraw
software.description: Draw on multiple frames in time.

software.name: Getting Away with Murder
software.description: Software for Papa Roach's "Getting Away with Murder" music video by Motion Theory

software.name: Ecstasy of Communication
software.description: Simulation developed to model the expected behavior of a physical sound installation. Both potential and actual network connections are shown.

software.name: D5LV
software.description: Exploring volume and emotional texture with simple generative geometry. Interaction and randomness modify the structure.

software.name: Presidential Discombobulator
software.description: Admire Bush's tough stance on gay marriage, but just can't get enough of John Edwards' pouty lips? Curious about what a long-facer like Kerry can bring to the table, but just know you'll miss Cheney's fangs if there's a democratic upset?

software.name: Friendster Pachinko
software.by: Krister Olsson with sound by Yoshi Sodeoka
software.description: Gambling with Friendsters! A variation on Pachinko, with friends instead of shiny metal balls.

software.name: Tokyo
software.description: Framerate and alpha values are stepped up and down. (Takes a long time to load, please be patient)

software.name: Portrait in Landscape
software.description: Playing with the idea of the 'portrait' or snapshot. How can motion add to the viewer's perception of the person?

software.name: TTC
software.description: Writing on a modular medium with recording & replaying capabilities. Give your fingers a few minutes on the keyboard to get warm.

software.name: Burning Liquid Sky
software.description: Playing with particles is fun. Give this one a few seconds to get warm.

software.name: Relations Environment
software.description: Each flocking creature connects with others by an ephemeral net of relations.

software.name: NudemenGarden
software.description: When the nude men come, the flowers blossom. Software for real-time video tracking and animation.

software.name: Star Nursery
software.description: Software for the R.E.M. video Animal. (Requires QuickTime)

software.name: Tech Support
software.description: The year is 2020. The future of computing is a battle between two opposing forces...

software.name: Base26
software.description: A spatial overview of four letter words in the English language.

software.name: Superhero
software.description: "To the rescue!" "I'll save you!" "You'll be safe!" "Don't worry!"

software.name: Cinema Redux
software.description: Compressing an entire film into a single image to reveal the editing rhythms and tone. Compare Vertigo, Taxi Driver, Deliverance, and more.

software.name: Version B
software.description: An undulating spatial construction. Click and drag the mouse to change view. Press keys 1 through 6 to change the visualization.

software.name: Bees
software.description: Particle collisions generate a familiar structure.

software.name: Bubble Chamber
software.description: A generative painting system of colliding particles. Oddly familiar patterns are transcribed as a discrete universe of four particle types.

software.name: Jack O Lantern
software.description: Pumpkin-feeding candy game using an off-the-shelf serial LCD module.

software.name: Sonic Wire Sculptor
software.description: Draw sonic sculptures with this 'rotating-table' instrument.

software.name: Tracking
software.description: Video footage of webcam interaction based on real-time tracking of light sources.

software.name: The Unbearable Lightness of Being a Pixel
software.description: Stir the pixel soup with your mouse. For additional flavors, press A, S, M.

software.name: Ricochet
software.description: Springy text collides with the edge of the image to jumble the forms. Press keys on your keyboard to generate new letters.

software.name: Skyline
software.description: An elegant cellular automata. An elusive structure is continually emerging and dispersing.

software.name: Wiggle
software.description: An expanding, contracting, and twisting responsive organ.

software.name: withoutTitle
software.description: A software machine exploring the boundaries of control.

software.name: Articulate
software.description: Structure emerges through the interactions of autonomous elements.

software.name: SodaProcessing
software.description: Simplified version of the renowned Soda Constructor implemented in Processing.

software.name: C_Drawer
software.description: Like drawing with a bunch of crayons in one hand. Simple and messy, but fun.

software.name: Inequality
software.description: In 2001 US CEOs were paid 411 times more than the average worker...

software.name: Pond
software.description: Autonomous bezier fish swarm around their liquid environment. Press keys 0-3 to hide and reveal predator fish.

software.name: Hin_und_Her
software.description: An interpretation of the poem 'Der und Die' by Ernst Jandl

software.name: Yellowtail
software.description: An interactive software system for the gestural creation and performance of real-time abstract animation.

software.name: Alphabot
software.description: Alphabot is a virtual robot that is able to take the shape of any letter in the English alphabet as you type them on a keyboard.

software.name: Europa
software.description: Creating a simulation from summery dreams of the one I love.

software.name: Matchboxes
software.description: Reassembling a movieclip database by using the properties of the collected information to generate a new visual data matrix.

software.name: Valence
software.description: An exploration into building representations for structures and relationships inside large sets of information.
